text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I’ve been on a popsicle binge lately, so
I thought,
I want to make another popsicle today!

So I’ve got my Zoku because it flash freezes
popsicles,

makes them really, really quick! And I wanted
to make another Mini Villain!

So, today we are gonna be making Root Beer
Float Goomba Popsicles!
Let’s get started!

The Goomba’s are so cute that it’s hard
for me to even be that mad at them

when I play Mario because they’re just so
cute!

The things you will need to make these Root
Beer Float popsicles will be:

1 bottle of Root Beer, 16 ounces, and you’re
gonna want the Root Beer to be

cold and flat, and that’s what I’ve done
here, I’ve poured it into a bowl,

and I’ve let it sit out. And I know that’s
really weird for soda, but,
that’s what you’re gonna want to do!

You’re also gonna need Vanilla Ice Cream,
You can use whatever is your favorite.

We’re gonna scoop a few scoops in here,
we’re just gonna eyeball it, I’ll show ya.

An ice cream scoop, a green apple, and some
black soft licorice,

for a little decoration. I know it’s a little
weird, but I’ll show you.

Also for tools you will need a mixing bowl,
a whisk and a Zoku.

A Zoku if you haven’t used it before, is
just a flash freeze popsicle maker.

It speeds up the process of making a popsicle,
to eight minutes!
Let’s put it all together!

The first thing that you’re gonna want to
do is put your Zoku into the freezer,

and let it sit there for 24 hours. So I like
to put it in the day before,
before you want to make these popsicles.

So I’m gonna go put it back in the freezer
right now, and then we’re gonna
make our Root Beer Float mixture!

Now we are gonna combined our root beer and
our vanilla ice cream into this

little mixing bowl. And remember, the Root
Beer, you want to let it sit out and

let all of the carbonation die,
which usually you never do with soda.

But for now, that’s what we’re gonna do,
so, pour in your Root Beer.

Now we’re gonna open your ice cream, and
you’re gonna scoop in a few scoops

and whisk it together, until we get the color
brown we want for our Goomba’s!

And this part is totally up to you, but I’m
gonna show you what I’m doing.
So here’s one scoop.

I wish this was just a Root Beer Float for
me right now!
A very generous three scoops!
And now, I’m gonna whisk it together.

So I just used a few scoops of ice cream,
but you can eyeball it to be any
color brown you want it to be.

I’m doing a little bit of a lighter color
than the normal, traditional Goomba.

But that’s just so we can see all of his
little facial features.

Now I’m gonna take my Root Beer Float popsicle
mixture and I’m gonna pour it

into a measuring cup with a pour spigot because
it makes it a little bit easier
to pour your popsicles.

Now I’m gonna take my Root Beer Float and
put it in the fridge, while we make some
Goomba faces!

Usually I decorate with the apples first,
but I didn’t want them to brown while they

were waiting, so that’s why we’re gonna
work with the licorice first.

So you’re gonna take your rolling pin, and
you’re gonna roll these pretty flat.
Gotta put your weight on it!
Uh, uh, uh, uh, uh!

Now that we got those rolled out, you’re
gonna take your little, teeny circle

cookie cutter, this comes in the little character
Zoku set, and we’re just gonna
cut out six eyeballs.

And then with the excess rolled out licorice,
we’re gonna cut some angry eyebrows!
Because Goombas are very angry!

Now you’re gonna take your sharp cutting
knife and we are gonna cut thin apple slices.

So watch your fingers, I’m doing this on
top of a little cutting board I’ve got here.

Once you’ve got your apple slices, you’re
gonna take a little teeny triangle

cookie cutter, I got a little teeny one, and
we’re just gonna cut out two triangles
for every popsicle again.

Now we’re gonna be making Goomba’s little
eyeballs.

And with the set it came with little circles,
but I kind of wanted an oval shape.

So, I found this, I’m just using what I
had around my kitchen.

I have a zero cookie cutter, and I liked the
inner oval, so I’m gonna be
using that to make eyeballs!

Got our little Goomba eyes all cut out now,
and now we are gonna cut off the top

at a diagonal angle, so we can stick on the
eyebrows, right on top.

So I’ll show you, you’re gonna take a
big cutting knife, and you’re just gonna
cut on the top, boop!

Now they are diagonal and you’re gonna do
that to the rest of your eyeballs!

Take the small circle cutter again, and now we’re
gonna cut out little eyeballs,
within our Goomba eyeball!

All of our decorations are ready and now we’re
going to assemble them onto this

little rubber spatula, I call it the popsicle
spatula.

So you’re gonna use this to design Goomba’s
face.

Take two of the eyeballs, dip them in water,
I’ve got a little bowl of water over here,

Then you’re gonna place them right on top,
I’m gonna place them in the middle.

And then, I’m gonna take two little triangles,
boop! Dip ‘em in water,

I’m placing them on the furthest ends, to
look like his snaggle teeth!

Two little teeny circle licorices, dip ‘em
in water, really quick.

Placing them in the middle of the eyeball,
now taking the two eyebrows again, dip
them in water, place ‘em on top.
Paddle is ready, now it’s going in.

So you want to be really careful not to touch
the top of the device until it’s
all the way in there, so be really careful!

And go all the way down, and once it’s all
the way down you’re gonna press up!
Boop!

And then all your little treats will stick
to the top of the popsicle maker.

Kind of like in the winter time, when you
lick a frozen pole.

You don’t want to ever do that, but it’s
the same kind of science that’s
happening there.

And then we’re gonna do that to the rest
of our popsicles!
Yay-uh! Ready to pour some popsicles!

You’re gonna take these little sticks, and
the Zoku comes with six of these, but I’m

just gonna make three today. And you just
place it, boop! Right in the middle.

And now, you’re gonna take your Root Beer
Float,
and you’re gonna pour it to the fill line.

Now you’re gonna let it sit for about eight
to ten minutes, and your

popsicles will completely freeze, and then,
I’ll show you how to take them out!

Our popsicles are now frozen, and I’m gonna
show you how to pop ‘em out
of this little thing!

You’re gonna take this little jobber, and
he’s got a screw in there, and you’ll
put ‘em on the top, and screw down.
Berwp-bewp-bewp-bewp-bewp!

And as you’re twisting down it will slowly
pull the pop up, and then you’re

gonna twist it the other way to loosen it,
bew-bew!
Rewp! Oh my gosh he’s so cute!
Ta-da! It’s a little Goomba face!

Now you’re gonna take this little guy, it’s
the drip tray.

And you’re gonna slide it on the bottom,
and pop it into place.
Ta-da!

Here are the Goomba Root Beer Float Popsicles
that we made today.
And, tastes test, they taste great!

I hope you guys enjoyed ‘em, these are super
easy mode, and they are really
fun treat to make, if you want a cool snack!

I’ll post some pictures on Facebook, Tumblr,
Instagram and Twitter,

and if you guys make these, please send me
a photo, or if you make any other
geeky popsicle, I would love to see it!

I get a big kick out of seeing your baking
creations, it just makes my day!

And if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies,

please let me know, leave me a comment down
below and
I will do my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks you guys, bye-bye!
Awwwww!
Mmmmmm!
